result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:38 pm.

2:31 PM Jeremy Eugene Ealy in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius appeared in court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF126, 22CF134, 22CF181 (PH). Atty Satorius: all PH will be a waiver. Court reviews and questions DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Maintain Absolute Sobriety 
Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

3:13 PM Defendant Jeremy Eugene Ealy appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appeared in court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting cash of $250.00 w/conditions of Maintain Absolute Sobriety , Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service.  & Not to possess any alcohol, objection. Court orders a $5,000.00 SIBS w/conditions requested. DE demands PH. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:22 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
